result.execSummary:
The defendant Glenn Michael Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: in lieu of $443 costs, Consecutive to 6 month sentence, but Concurrent with sentence now serving

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Defendant Glenn Michael Hanson in court in custody with attorney Sean Drury.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deft pleads No Contest freely and voluntarily; Court accepts plea and finds Deft Guilty; Court orders: 6 months RCJail, Concurrent with sentence now serving; 46 days credit; $443 costs - 9 days RCJail in lieu of $443 costs; 100 hours Community Service, 9 days to be served Consecutive to 6 months sentence, Concurrent with sentence now serving.
Status conference on February 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Glenn Michael Hanson in court in custody with attorney Sean Drury.  Lindsay Beth Healless appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to Defendant, penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Not guilty plea
